Fallout 
By @rhiancahill 
Is releasing May 26, 2022!

Preorder today on Amazon! 
http://mybook.to/falloutrc
Goodreads: https://bit.ly/3b8CuN6

Blurb

The past brought them together. It could also tear them apart.

Jake Conners is ready to put the past behind him and give his son‚Äîthe one good thing to come out of a disastrous relationship‚Äîthe best he can. Moving to Sunnyville to rebuild their lives and repair the friendship his ex ruined is the new beginning they both need.

Mallory Dawson is in Sunnyville to make amends for her stepsister. She never meant to get close to Jacob or Maddox but living in the garage apartment of their new house keeps her in constant contact and as each day passes, she's pulled into their lives and closer to the duo.

The last thing either of them wants is a relationship, but as their friendship grows their connection becomes harder to deny. With each encounter Jake‚Äôs heart opens more and Mallory‚Äôs love for Maddox is one the toddler never received from anyone other than Jake.

But when Mallory's link to Jake‚Äôs past is revealed the fallout leaves her without a place to live and a broken heart. With the threat her family represents, she's forced to accept the budding relationship the three of them have is gone.

Devastated and with no hope of getting the thing she wants most‚Äîa family with Jacob and Maddox‚ÄîMallory is willing to put everything‚Äîincluding her life‚Äîon the line to ensure her stepsister can never again hurt the two people she loves most.

Rhian Cahill‚Äôs Fallout is an emotional, single dad, second chance contemporary romance written in K. Bromberg‚Äôs Everyday Heroes Worlds project.

#kbworlds #everydayheroesworld #rhiancahill #falloutbook #singledadromance #GreysPromo

So much fun to chat with @mngrenside yesterday about his outstanding debut thriller FALL OUT, current and future projects, and his wildly entertaining and varied career as a Film and TV producer.

Plus amazing stories about crime fiction, murder, Muppets, and wrestling crocodiles!

Thank you to Mark, @erikdsouzareal, @crimewriterscanada, @bobharris_awriter, @bloodhound.books, and @newest.press for the opportunity!

Scored a cheeky little bargain on eBay ü§©. #falloutcommunity #fallout #falloutcollection #falloutbook

April Wrap Up üå±

A month late ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I really loved so many of the books I read in April. Still on the historical fiction train, The Rose Code was such a great story of the female decoders at Bletchly Park and I learned so much from The Fruit of the Drunken Tree, a story based in Colombia during a period of incredible turmoil. Radium Girls was so beautifully researched that I am still angry about the story - another fantastic example of how important it is to take a broader view of what stories are considered worthy of historical record. 

Read This Now ü§Ø
* Radium Girls - Kate Moore 
* The Rose Code - Kate Quinn
* Fruit of the Drunken Tree - Ingrid  Rojas Contreras

Pretty Darn Good üòÄ 
* Fallout - Lesley M.M. Blume
* The Year of Magical Thinking -  Joan Didion

Sure üôÇ
* Kiss Hard - Nalini Singh

As we approach the 60th anniversary of the Cuban Missile Crisis, we are once again very close to a nuclear war. #candlewickpress #toddstrasserauthor #nuclearwar #ukraine #ukrainewar #worldwar3 #falloutbook #fallout

Fallout by Steve Sheinkin

Sheinkin is a master at writing nonfiction that pulls you in like a spy novel. This book about the build up to - and the 13 days of - the Cuban Missile Crisis was a bit difficult to read right now, but also a very important book to read. Right now.

#nonfiction
#historybooks
#hunickereads
#ritba2023
#falloutbook 
@stevesheinkin 
@riteenbookaward

Luke's coincidental book selection about the Cold War prior to the recent Russian invasion of Ukraine

Review from Publishers Weekly:
 This twisty spy story interweaves tautly paced political drama to document the perilous Cold War period and escalating conflict between the United States and Soviet Union.

Newbery Honoree @stevesheinkin immediately hooks readers with an account of how a 1953 chance exchange of two hollow coins with film hidden inside tipped the CIA off to a Soviet spy ring; eventually, the lens extends to the Cuban Missile Crisis and the standoff between U.S. president John F. Kennedy and Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev. 
  In addition to spies and political machinations, Sheinkin skillfully describes the science behind the race to develop fission bombs and conquer space, the nuclear threat and mutually assured destruction, and how the fear and classroom drills infused everyday life.

#falloutbook #cubanmisslecrisis #kruschev #jfk #coldwar #sovietunion #ussr #ukraine #u2pilot #invasion

What's the longest you've had a book on your tbr and finally read?

In August 2013 I read and reviewed (on my blog! Before insta was the way to talk books) book one in a series. It was called Compound and I absolutely loved it and immediately bought book 2.

I started book 2, Fallout, last night - February 2022 ü§£üò¢ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

This book even made the cut when we sold our home of 20 years and moved to West Virginia 6 years ago.

So far I'm enjoying it and am gobsmacked I can recall so much of book 1. That says a lot about how much I liked the first book and how much long term memory stores things, yet I can't recall last week's books so well. Don't get old.

Fallout by Lesley M.M. Blume

I read this story first to understand how John Hersey became the reporter to write detail accounts of those affected. I think both stories should be read no matter the order. This book is short and gives a lot of information about other reporters that were given permission to enter the country but had their stories confiscated in the end. #reading #readersofinstagram #falloutbook #lesleymmblume #journalism
#newbooks #unboxing ! #librarylife

I made the iguana-on-a-stick fallout recipe for my dinner. it's delicious, I recommend you try to do it #fallout #fallout3 #falloutnewvegas #falloutnv #fallout4 #fallout76 #fo76 #iguanaonastick #falloutfood #falloutbook #falloutnewvegasiguanaonastick #fallout4iguanaonastick #fallout76iguanaonastick

I couldn‚Äôt put this book down! I loved exploring what disaster does to a person, and how we all might react when faced with a scary fallout. I was also squirming at times at the blurred boundaries between renter and landlord at this vacation property. 
While I enjoyed it thoroughly, I felt a little unsatisfied at the end. It‚Äôs been said that this is going to be a Netflix movie starring Denzel Washington and Julia Roberts, although when, I‚Äôm unsure. Maybe the movie will have a more complete ending? Or perhaps there will be a sequel? I hope so! Tell me your thoughts on this, and what you think the sound was. Did I miss some answers when I read this?? 
.

Fallout by Lesley Blume‚Å£
‚Å£
Seventy-five years ago today, on the morning of 6 August 1945, the United States dropped an atomic bomb on Hiroshima.‚Å£
‚Å£
For nearly a year, the true effects were covered up by the US ‚Äî until New Yorker journalist John Hersey got into Hiroshima and reported the truth to the world.‚Å£
‚Å£
New York Times bestselling author @lesleymmblume reveals the remarkable true story in FALLOUT.‚Å£
‚Å£
‚ÄòThe dramatic story of how John Hersey produced what is widely regarded as the greatest piece of American journalism of the 20th century.‚Äô‚Å£
‚Äî Carl Bernstien, Pulitzer‚Äìwinning co-author of All The President‚Äôs Men‚Å£
‚Å£
üéßListen to Lesley on ABC‚Äôs Focus via the link in our bio.
